title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 71.2 - Questions raised; scope of inquiry
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 71.2 - Questions raised; scope of inquiry

State Regulations

The fundamental questions that may be raised in a
proceeding under this Part are whether, in issuing the order to comply, the
provisions of the minimum wage act or of the minimum wage order or the
regulations under which the order to comply was made were correctly construed
and applied to a given state of facts, or whether the computation of the amount
of an underpayment is erroneous. Such proceeding shall not be used to challenge
the terms of requirements of a minimum wage order or of a
regulation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
71.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
